post.desc:
My≈çrenji about to see a huge hike in donations.

Huh... do you guys know what the Buddhist explanation for the rabbit on the moon is? One of Buddha's past life was a rabbit. The story is kinda weird, but it turned to the rabbit offering itself to be eaten by the starving brahma. When the rabbit jumped into the fire, it was cold. Turns out it was a test. For this supreme selflessness, the image of a rabbit was inscribed onto the moon.

How would this Jakata tale apply to our moon rabbits though? ü§î
